s.text: Synopses, written by PLoS Medicine 's professional editors, should provide any health professional with a quick introduction to an article.

Medical journals have allowed their interests to become aligned with those of the pharmaceutical industry by printing advertisements for drugs, publishing trials designed by drug companies' marketing departments, and making profits on reprints used as marketing tools.
We require authors to tell us of any possible competing interests; we in turn will tell readers about them.
So the revolutionary idea of anyone being able to read any article is possible.
We are delighted that members of our editorial board have also shown their support for our journal by submitting papers to us, even before we launched.
We are delighted that members of our editorial board have also shown their support for our journal by submitting papers to us, even before we launched.
We are delighted that members of our editorial board have also shown their support for our journal by submitting papers to us, even before we launched.
Perspectives, written by an expert, are aimed at readers who are already familiar with the topic.
As academic editors they, along with a senior editor at the journal, take research papers through the peer review process in a way that we believe provides the most constructive and fair review.
As academic editors they, along with a senior editor at the journal, take research papers through the peer review process in a way that we believe provides the most constructive and fair review.
Our large global editorial board reflects the diversity of medicine today and is intimately involved in what we do.
In particular, members of the editorial board are a crucial part of our peer review process.
We are delighted that members of our editorial board have also shown their support for our journal by submitting papers to us, even before we launched.
